1.verse: The oracle that Habakkuk the prophet saw.

2.verse: O Lord , how long shall I cry for help,

3.verse: Why do you make me see iniquity,

6.verse: For behold, I am raising up the Chaldeans,

8.verse: Their horses are swifter than leopards,

11.verse: Then they sweep by like the wind and go on,

13.verse: You who are of purer eyes than to see evil

14.verse: You make mankind like the fish of the sea,

15.verse: He brings all of them up with a hook;

16.verse: Therefore he sacrifices to his net

17.verse: Is he then to keep on emptying his net

1.verse: I will take my stand at my watchpost

3.verse: For still the vision awaits its appointed time;

4.verse: “Behold, his soul is puffed up; it is not upright within him,

6.verse: Shall not all these take up their taunt against him, with scoffing and riddles for him, and say,

7.verse: Will not your debtors suddenly arise,

8.verse: Because you have plundered many nations,

9.verse: “Woe to him who gets evil gain for his house,

10.verse: You have devised shame for your house

11.verse: For the stone will cry out from the wall,

12.verse: “Woe to him who builds a town with blood

13.verse: Behold, is it not from the Lord of hosts

14.verse: For the earth will be filled

15.verse: “Woe to him who makes his neighbors drink—

16.verse: You will have your fill of shame instead of glory.

17.verse: The violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you,

19.verse: Woe to him who says to a wooden thing, Awake;

20.verse: But the Lord is in his holy temple;

1.verse: A prayer of Habakkuk the prophet, according to Shigionoth.

2.verse: O Lord , I have heard the report of you,

4.verse: His brightness was like the light;

6.verse: He stood and measured the earth;

7.verse: I saw the tents of Cushan in affliction;

8.verse: Was your wrath against the rivers, O Lord ?

9.verse: You stripped the sheath from your bow,

10.verse: The mountains saw you and writhed;

11.verse: The sun and moon stood still in their place

12.verse: You marched through the earth in fury;

13.verse: You went out for the salvation of your people,

14.verse: You pierced with his own arrows the heads of his warriors,

15.verse: You trampled the sea with your horses,

16.verse: I hear, and my body trembles;

17.verse: Though the fig tree should not blossom,

18.verse: yet I will rejoice in the Lord ;

19.verse: God , the Lord, is my strength;
